text:
(Actually 1.7.2, but Bugzilla doesn't know about that version).

The HTTP Proxy's include and exclude patterns are currently matched against the
request's domain and path; they should be matched against the entire URL,
including the port number and query string.

Why:
  - Port #: I was trying to match against the port number of my private Apache
instance (associated with my CVS sandbox), and had to read the source to figure
out why this was failing
  - Query string: I haven't (yet) found a need for it, but then I've only just
started using the proxy server.  Notwithstanding that, matching against the
entire URL is the Right Thing to do.  Principle of Least Surprise and all that.
creator: eric_97@pobox.com

text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
